title: Android December Security Update essentially bricked my Pixel 2 XL
content:
After reading about the terrible permanent denial of a service problem, I installed the December Android security update, which installed without any issues. Immediately after though, My phone became essentially unusable, because it continually says: "Pixel Launcher keeps stopping" 

To do ANYTHING, you have to press "close app" then quickly try to type a letter or press onscreen, because our good buddy "Pixel Launcher keeps stopping" will pop up in less than one second. 

I have tried safe mode, I have tried everything, and it still does it. I'm going to have to do a factory reset now, after maddening attempts to get a couple of crucial files removed with the fast press method described above.

I would warn anyone who wants to install the December update that they do so at their own risk, based on my experience. I am a long-time android user, very experienced, and don't have any sketchy software or apps on this particular phone. I have never experienced anything like this with one of these updates.

Google can send me a new phone for alerting them to this issue.
